frame.name: Desirability
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns an <fen>Evaluee</fen> being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked. In many cases, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is implicitly judged good or bad relative to other instances of its type. The <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s desirability is determined by one or more <fen>Parameter</fen>s, which are scalar properties of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>. The evaluation may also explicitly be relativized to a set of <fen>Circumstances</fen>, a <fen>Comparison_set</fen> of entities that belong to the same class as the <fen>Evaluee</fen>, or an <fen>Affected_party</fen>. The <fen>Degree</fen> of goodness or badness may also be expressed.
Note: With some targets, desirability is conventionally aligned with quantity, i.e., GOOD is MORE.
<ex><fex name="Evaluee">The view</fex> was <t>astonishing</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Circumstances">On clear days</fex>, <fex name="Evaluee">the view</fex> was <t>excellent</t>.</ex> <ex>The book is <t>astounding</t> <fex name="Parameter">in its scope</fex>.</ex> <ex>The games have been <t>awful</t> <fex name="Affected_party">for the team</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
<ex> He gave me another <t>lame</t> <fex name="Evaluee">excuse</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged good or bad.
<ex> Smithers was doing an <fex name="Degree">absolutely</fex> <t>splendid</t> job.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> marks expressions that indicate a set of conditions under which the quality of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged.
<ex>It's a <t>great</t> <fex name="Evaluee">game</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">when it rains</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
<ex>The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex name="Parameter">in freshness</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Comparison_set
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate what class of things or events the Evaluee is being judged against.
<ex><fex name="Parameter">The standard of living</fex> is <t>poor</t> <fex name="Comparison_set">compared to other Western industrialized countries</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Affected_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Affected_party</fen> indicates entities that benefit or suffer from the good or bad quality of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
<ex>The season was <t>splendid</t> <fex name="Affected_party">for the team</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Depictive</fen> encodes a state that the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is in and which does not represent a temporary or hypothetical set of <fen>Circumstances</fen>.
<ex>The aerial view is <t>superb</t> <fex name="Depictive">with its view of the harbour</fex>.</ex></def-root>
